title: Folders with missing path are not restarted by "Rescan all"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Dear Team

Usecase:
I share a few larger, slow changing folders from inside a truecrypt container. I use a high rescan interval, because I use to work with the data and I dont want to sync before I am done. (work is ususally below 10 min, like copying pictures inside and renaming them.) I set the other side to "versioning" and I dont want copies of all that renaming on that side.
After mounting, I usually click "rescan all" to get them from stopped to alive.

what happend:
With the change from v0.14.26 to v0.14.27, the functionality of the "Rescan all" Button changed.
Before: 
Stopped Folders would be checked if they are "alive" again
Now:
Stopped Folders are skipped during the "Rescan all" function

Folders can only get "alive" again, if the rescan interval is due.

what you expected to happen instead:
Stopped Folders would be checked if they are "alive" again

any steps to reproduce the problem:
unmount a shared folder 
start Syncthing
rescan the folder > status is "Stopped"
mount folder again
press "Rescan all" or "Rescan" on the individual folder. (Same effect: No effect)

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.27 (rc2 and rc3)
OS Version: Windows 7 
Browser Version: Using Syncthing Trazor
